segment.source: Prepare your environment for Microsoft Surface Hub
segment.target: Prepare your environment for Microsoft Surface Hub

segment.source: This section contains an overview of the steps required to prepare your environment so that you can use all of the features of Microsoft Surface Hub.
segment.target: This section contains an overview of the steps required to prepare your environment so that you can use all of the features of Microsoft Surface Hub.

segment.source: Prepare your environment for Microsoft Surface Hub
segment.target: Prepare your environment for Microsoft Surface Hub

segment.source: This section contains an overview of the steps required to prepare your environment so that you can use all of the features of Microsoft Surface Hub.
segment.target: This section contains an overview of the steps required to prepare your environment so that you can use all of the features of Microsoft Surface Hub.

segment.source: See Intro to Surface Hub for a description of how the device and its features interact with your IT environment.
segment.target: See Intro to Surface Hub for a description of how the device and its features interact with your IT environment.

segment.source: Create and test a device account
segment.target: Create and test a device account

segment.source: A "device account" is an account that Surface Hub uses in order to access features from Exchange, like email and calendar, and to enable Skype for Business.
segment.target: A "device account" is an account that Surface Hub uses in order to access features from Exchange, like email and calendar, and to enable Skype for Business.

segment.source: See Create and test a device account for details.
segment.target: See Create and test a device account for details.

segment.source: Check network availability
segment.target: Check network availability

segment.source: In order to function properly, the Surface Hub must have access to a wired or wireless network that meets these requirements:
segment.target: In order to function properly, the Surface Hub must have access to a wired or wireless network that meets these requirements:

segment.source: Access to your Active Directory or Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) instance, as well as your Microsoft Exchange and Skype for Business servers
segment.target: Access to your Active Directory or Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) instance, as well as your Microsoft Exchange and Skype for Business servers

segment.source: Can receive an IP address using DHCP
segment.target: Can receive an IP address using DHCP

segment.source: Open ports:
segment.target: Open ports:

segment.source: HTTPS: 443
segment.target: HTTPS: 443

segment.source: HTTP: 8080
segment.target: HTTP: 8080

segment.source: A wired connection is preferred.
segment.target: A wired connection is preferred.

segment.source: Certificates
segment.target: Certificates

segment.source: Your Surface Hub may require certificates for ActiveSync, Skype for Business, network usage, or other authentication.
segment.target: Your Surface Hub may require certificates for ActiveSync, Skype for Business, network usage, or other authentication.

segment.source: To install certificates, you can either create a provisioning package (in order to install at first run, or after first run in Settings), or deploy them through a mobile device management (MDM) solution (after first run only).
segment.target: To install certificates, you can either create a provisioning package (in order to install at first run, or after first run in Settings), or deploy them through a mobile device management (MDM) solution (after first run only).

segment.source: To install certificates using provisioning packages, see Create provisioning packages.
segment.target: To install certificates using provisioning packages, see Create provisioning packages.

segment.source: To install them using MDM, see the documentation for your MDM solution.
segment.target: To install them using MDM, see the documentation for your MDM solution.

segment.source: Create provisioning packages
segment.target: Create provisioning packages

segment.source: Currently, Surface Hub can use provisioning packages only to install certificates and to install Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.
segment.target: Currently, Surface Hub can use provisioning packages only to install certificates and to install Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.

segment.source: See Create provisioning packages for details.
segment.target: See Create provisioning packages for details.

segment.source: Customers will use provisioning packages to authenticate (for example, to Exchange or Skype for Business), or to sideload apps that don't come from the Windows Store or Windows Store for Business.
segment.target: Customers will use provisioning packages to authenticate (for example, to Exchange or Skype for Business), or to sideload apps that don't come from the Windows Store or Windows Store for Business.

segment.source: Know the Exchange server for your device account
segment.target: Know the Exchange server for your device account

segment.source: You should know which Exchange server the device account will use for email and calendar services.
segment.target: You should know which Exchange server the device account will use for email and calendar services.

segment.source: The device will attempt to discover this automatically during first run, but if auto-discovery doesn't work, you may need to enter the server info manually.
segment.target: The device will attempt to discover this automatically during first run, but if auto-discovery doesn't work, you may need to enter the server info manually.

segment.source: Admin group management
segment.target: Admin group management

segment.source: Every Surface Hub can be configured individually by opening the Settings app on the device.
segment.target: Every Surface Hub can be configured individually by opening the Settings app on the device.

segment.source: To prevent people who are not administrators from changing settings, the Settings app requires local administrator credentials to open the app and change settings.
segment.target: To prevent people who are not administrators from changing settings, the Settings app requires local administrator credentials to open the app and change settings.

segment.source: See Admin group management for details on how admin groups are set up and managed.
segment.target: See Admin group management for details on how admin groups are set up and managed.

segment.source: Skype for Business
segment.target: Skype for Business

segment.source: Certificates may be required in order to have the Surface Hub use Skype for Business.
segment.target: Certificates may be required in order to have the Surface Hub use Skype for Business.

segment.source: Checklist for preparation
segment.target: Checklist for preparation

segment.source: In order to ensure that your environment is ready for the Surface Hub, verify the items in the following list.
segment.target: In order to ensure that your environment is ready for the Surface Hub, verify the items in the following list.

segment.source: The device account has been created.
segment.target: The device account has been created.

segment.source: Test this by running:
segment.target: Test this by running:

segment.source: Surface Hub device account validation PowerShell scripts
segment.target: Surface Hub device account validation PowerShell scripts

segment.source: Lync Windows app from the Windows Store (if Lync runs successfully, then Skype for Business will most likely run).
segment.target: Lync Windows app from the Windows Store (if Lync runs successfully, then Skype for Business will most likely run).

segment.source: Ensure that there is a working network/Internet connection for the device to connect to:
segment.target: Ensure that there is a working network/Internet connection for the device to connect to:

segment.source: It must be able to receive an IP address using DHCP (Surface Hub cannot be configured with a static IP address)
segment.target: It must be able to receive an IP address using DHCP (Surface Hub cannot be configured with a static IP address)

segment.source: It must have these ports open:
segment.target: It must have these ports open:

segment.source: HTTPS: 443
segment.target: HTTPS: 443

segment.source: HTTP: 8080
segment.target: HTTP: 8080

segment.source: If your network runs through a proxy, you'll need the proxy address or script information as well.
segment.target: If your network runs through a proxy, you'll need the proxy address or script information as well.

segment.source: In order to improve your experience, we collect data.
segment.target: In order to improve your experience, we collect data.

segment.source: To collect data, we need these sites whitelisted:
segment.target: To collect data, we need these sites whitelisted:

segment.source: Telemetry client endpoint: https://vortex.data.microsoft.com/
segment.target: Telemetry client endpoint: https://vortex.data.microsoft.com/

segment.source: Telemetry settings endpoint: https://settings.data.microsoft.com/
segment.target: Telemetry settings endpoint: https://settings.data.microsoft.com/

segment.source: Choose the local admin method you want to set up during first run (see Set up admins for this device).
segment.target: Choose the local admin method you want to set up during first run (see Set up admins for this device).

segment.source: Also, decide whether you'll be using MDM (see Manage settings with an MDM provider).
segment.target: Also, decide whether you'll be using MDM (see Manage settings with an MDM provider).

segment.source: You've created provisioning packages, as needed.
segment.target: You've created provisioning packages, as needed.

segment.source: See Create provisioning packages.
segment.target: See Create provisioning packages.

segment.source: Have all necessary information available from the Setup worksheet.
segment.target: Have all necessary information available from the Setup worksheet.

segment.source: In this section
segment.target: In this section

segment.source: Topic
segment.target: Topic

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Create and test a device account
segment.target: Create and test a device account

segment.source: This topic introduces how to create and test the device account that Surface Hub uses to communicate with and Skype.
segment.target: This topic introduces how to create and test the device account that Surface Hub uses to communicate with and Skype.

segment.source: Create provisioning packages
segment.target: Create provisioning packages

segment.source: For Windows 10, settings that use the registry or a content services platform (CSP) can be configured using provisioning packages.
segment.target: For Windows 10, settings that use the registry or a content services platform (CSP) can be configured using provisioning packages.

segment.source: You can also add certificates during first run using provisioning.
segment.target: You can also add certificates during first run using provisioning.

segment.source: Admin group management
segment.target: Admin group management

segment.source: Every Surface Hub can be configured individually by opening the Settings app on the device.
segment.target: Every Surface Hub can be configured individually by opening the Settings app on the device.

segment.source: However, to prevent people who are not administrators from changing the settings, the Settings app requires administrator credentials to open the app and change settings.
segment.target: However, to prevent people who are not administrators from changing the settings, the Settings app requires administrator credentials to open the app and change settings.

segment.source: The Settings app requires local administrator credentials to open the app.
segment.target: The Settings app requires local administrator credentials to open the app.
